text: Cape Penck is an ice-covered point on the coast of Antarctica.Ute Christina Herzfeld, Atlas of Antarctica: Topographic Maps from Geostatistical Analysis of Satellite Radar Altimeter Data (Berlin; London: Springer, 2004), p. 89 Cape Penck is just east of Philippi Glacier. It separates the Leopold and Astrid Coast from the Kaiser Wilhelm II Coast.John Stewart, Antarctica: an encyclopedia, Volume 3 (Jefferson, NC: McFarland, 1990), p. 757 It was named for Albrecht Penck, who was a German geographer. == References == Category:Geography of Antarctica
title: Cape Penck
